definition: in a great mess/chaotic
in confusion or disorder/in a confused state of mind/disorder/upheaval/riot/illicit sexual relations/to throw into disorder/to mix up/indiscriminate/random/arbitrary
surname Cheng
to succeed/to finish/to complete/to accomplish/to become/to turn into/to be all right/OK!/one tenth
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
round/lump/ball/to roll into a ball/to gather/regiment/group/society/classifier for a lump or a soft mass: wad (of paper), ball (of wool), cloud (of smoke)

sentences.english: Jack shot from out of a ruck of players.
sentences.chinese: 傑克從亂成一團的運動員中把球踢出。

sentences.english: There was utter pandemonium outside the university building as ambulances carted away the injured.
sentences.chinese: 隨着救護車帶走受傷的人，大學主樓外絕對亂成一團。

sentences.english: His room is a mess. He cannot find his soccer jersey.
sentences.chinese: 房間亂成一團，他的球衣也不知道扔哪去了。

sentences.english: A： This place has been a mess since your cat， Sweet， moved in.
sentences.chinese: 自從你的貓甜甜搬進來之後，這地方就亂成一團。

sentences.english: The spools of thread in this box have become tangled.
sentences.chinese: 這個盒子的線軸都亂成一團了。

sentences.english: The thread has got all snarled up; I can't untie it.
sentences.chinese: 線都亂成一團了，我解不開了。

sentences.english: If pages are cluttered people can't find information.
sentences.chinese: 如果頁面亂成一團糟，那麼人們就沒法找着信息。

definition: to have a clear view of things/to adapt to circumstances
misconception/fallacy
to condemn in speech and in writing (idiom)/to denounce by word and pen
to make an irrelevant comparison or interpretation (idiom)
harmful teachings/evil doctrine
to fight openly and maneuver covertly (idiom)
to think for oneself and act accordingly (idiom); to act on one's own initiative
no way out/nowhere to go/trapped beyond hope of rescue/painted into a corner
irreverent
conclusion/judgment/verdict
scoundrel/rogue/bully/villain
to act in collusion (idiom); in cahoots with/villains will look after one another
to glare at
not the least bit concerned/completely indifferent
red in the face/extremely angry
to be drowned (figurative and literal)
